item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Catherine Aird
item.description: "If you can't be a good example, then you'll just have to be a horrible warning." -- Catherine Aird

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Wit beyond measure is a man's greatest treasure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Differences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "He is a gentleman, and I am a gentleman's daughter. So far we are equal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "One man's ways may be as good as another's, but we all like our own best." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It's not vanity to know your own good points. It would just be stupidity if you didn't; It's only vanity when you get puffed up about them." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "Step follows step, Hope follows Courage, Set your face towards danger, Set your heart on victory." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life isn't fair, it's just fairer than death, that's all." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "I love you,' Buttercup said. 'I know this must come as something of a surprise to you, since all I've ever done is scorn you and degrade you and taunt you, but I have loved you for several hours now, and every second, more. I thought an hour ago that I loved you more than any woman has ever loved a man, but a half hour after that I knew that what I felt before was nothing compared to what I felt then. But ten minutes after that, I understood that my previous love was a puddle compared to the high seas before a storm. Your eyes are like that, did you know? Well they are. How many minutes ago was I? Twenty? Had I brought my feelings up to then? It doesn't matter.' Buttercup still could not look at him. The sun was rising behind her now; she could feel the heat on her back, and it gave her courage. 'I love you so much more now than twenty minutes ago that there cannot be comparison. I love you so much more now then when you opened your hovel door, there cannot be comparison. There is no room in my body for anything but you. My arms love you, my ears adore you, my knees shake with blind affection. My mind begs you to ask it something so it can obey. Do you want me to follow you for the rest of your days? I will do that. Do you want me to crawl? I will crawl. I will be quiet for you or sing for you, or if you are hungry, let me bring you food, or if you have thirst and nothing will quench it but Arabian wine, I will go to Araby, even though it is across the world, and bring a bottle back for your lunch. Anything there is that I can do for you, I will do for you; anything there is that I cannot do, I will learn to do. I know I cannot compete with the Countess in skills or wisdom or appeal, and I saw the way she looked at you. And I saw the way you looked at her. But remember, please, that she is old and has other interests, while I am seventeen and for me there is only you. Dearest Westley--I've never called you that before, have I?--Westley, Westley, Westley, Westley, Westley,--darling Westley, adored Westley, sweet perfect Westley, whisper that I have a chance to win your love.' And with that, she dared the bravest thing she'd ever done; she looked right into his eyes." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Who says life is fair, where is that written?" -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Do I love you? My God, if your love were a grain of sand, mine would be a universe of beaches." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "There have been five great kisses since 1642 B.C...(before then couples hooked thumbs.) And the precise rating of kisses is a terribly difficult thing, often leading to great controversy.... Well, this one left them all behind." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description:
"you were already more beautiful than anything I dared to dream. In our years apart, my imaginings did their best to improve on you perfection. At night, your face was forever behind my eyes. And now I see that that vision who kept me company in my loneliness was a hag compared to the beauty now before me.” –Westley
Enough about my beauty.” Buttercup said. “Everybody always talks about how beautiful I am. I’ve got a mind, Westley. Talk about that." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "I've been saying it so long to you, you just wouldn't listen. Every time you said 'Farm Boy do this' you thought I was answering 'As you wish' but that's only because you were hearing wrong. 'I love you' was what it was, but you never heard." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Love is many things none of them logical." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "I just know once you're over your emotional outbursts, you'll come up with-' I mean if we even had a wheelbarrow, that would be something,' Westley said." -- William Goldman

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "When I fall in love, it will be forever." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "If I could but know his heart, everything would become easy." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Emma Thompson
item.description: "Can he love her? Can the soul really be satisfied with such polite affections? To love is to burn - to be on fire, like Juliet or Guinevere or Eloise..." -- Emma Thompson

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Elinor could sit still no longer. She almost ran out of the room, and as soon as the door was closed, burst into tears of joy, which at first she thought would never cease." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sheralyn add a quote by Andrew Davies
item.description:
"It is not what we say or feel that makes us what we are. It is what we do...or fail to do.
Marianne, BBC 2007 Production of Jane Austen's Sense and Sensibility." -- Andrew Davies
